content: 1995 Singaporean television film ***Cupid Love*** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 七月俏佳人) is a 1995 Singaporean television film which spawned the popular duet "Guan Huai Fang Shi" performed by Chua Lee Lian and [Chen Hanwei](/wiki/Chen_Hanwei). Directed by Sampson Yuen, the feature-length telemovie stars [Athena Chu](/wiki/Athena_Chu) and Chen Hanwei. It also features 1995 *[Star Search](/wiki/Star_Search_(Singaporean_TV_series))* contestants Ziozio Lim, Robin Goh and Aric Ho. ## Synopsis The plot follows a [getai](/wiki/Getai) singer who falls in love with her American [pen pal](/wiki/Pen_pal), and finds out that he is the son of a wealthy man and is suffering from a terminal illness. ## Cast - [Chen Hanwei](/wiki/Chen_Hanwei) as Xu Wenqiang - Koay Jing Li as young Xu Wenqiang - [Athena Chu](/wiki/Athena_Chu) as Deng Qingqing - Fan Wenqing as young Deng Qingqing - [Koh Chieng Mun](/wiki/Koh_Chieng_Mun) as Deng Xiaoling - Ziozio Lim as Deng Meimei - Robin Goh as Paul - Aric Ho as Ah Jian (Coffee King) - Wang Changli as Cousin Sen - Zhou Quanxi as Uncle Chen - Wu Weiqiang as Sen's father - Chen Xuefen as Judy - Huang Benxin as Judy's boyfriend - *Cupid Love* at [IMDb](/wiki/IMDb_(identifier)) This article related to a Singaporean film is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Cupid Love
